item.title: Scientist developes a Brain-To-Twitter Interface
item.description: Related articles by Zemanta {.zemanta-related-title} Image via CrunchBase Adam Wilson, biomedical engineering doctoral student at University of Wisconsin-Madison has developed a brain to computer interface which makes it possible to directly write tweets through thoughts. ReadWriteWeb writes: Technically, what Wilson did was come up with an interface combining an Electroencephalogram, or brain wave monitor, with an on screen keyboard for selecting letters.
